sect1.title: Conclusion
sect1.para: As you could see, BEEN's support for scripting is very powerful tool that could radically speed up development of new tasks. When using scripts for a good purpose (which can be e.g. building binaries from sources), the resulting code is much shorter and simpler than it would be in Java. Of course, not every task can be written using shell scripting, but the way a shell script can interact with BEEN environment will probably make shell scripting powerful enough to use shell scripts for many commons tasks. And in case shell scripting is not satisfactory for some kind of task, you can always try to implement the same in Jython (that has almost the same power as tasks written in Java but is still a scripting language).
